resources.string: Section A: Identification Information (HH): Section A: Identification Information (HH)
The name of head of the household corresponds to the line listing data.
Name of new head of the household
Before progressing, take consent; did you get permission? If permission was not granted, stop interviewing and proceed to the next household.
Age of respondent (In Years) (Minimum age: 18 years)
Literacy level of respondent: Now I would like you to read this sentence to me. SHOW CARD TO RESPONDENT If respondent cannot read whole sentence, PROBE: Can you read any part of the sentence to me?
Able to Read Only Part of The Sentence
Qualification of respondent Mention completed years of education; Code: 55 for uneducated, 17 for Professional and 22 for only religious studies
Is respondent the head of household?
Profession of head of household (Use Below codes)
Male members including male children of all ages
Female members including female children of all ages
Was this birth registered? If yes with?
Has the child had diarrhea in the last two weeks?
How much was given to drink to the child during the diarrhoea episode?
How much was given to eat to the child during the diarrhoea episode?
Did you seek advice or treatment for the diarrhoea from any source?
Where did you seek advice or treatment for diarrhoea?
What Was Given to Treat Diarrhea?
Why did you not seek treatment?
Confidence that child will get better himself
Was the child given Zinc supplements?
Has the child been sick with cough in the past two weeks?
Has the child been sick with fever in the past two weeks?
Has (NAME) had fast, short, rapid breaths or difficulty breathing at any time in the last 2 weeks?
Was the fast or difficult breathing due to a problem in the chest or to a blocked or runny nose?
Did you seek treatment from any source?
Where did you seek advice or treatment for cough, fever or difficulty breathing?
What Was Given to Treat cough, fever or difficulty breathing?
Why did you not seek treatment?
Confidence that child will get better himself
Section IM: Child Immunization INSTRUCTION Complete Section IM for all children in household 35 months and under (if more than one child, then use another sheet)
Did you ever have a vaccination card from a Government or private health provider where (name)’s vaccinations are written down?
If yes: may I see it please? The respondent should already have brought the card when you got permission to begin the interview.
If not, why you didn’t receive any vaccination card?
Could not visit a facility because of COVID-19
Card was not available with the health provider
The vaccinator/ facility didn’t provide the card
Check and copy Date of Birth recorded on card:

INSTRUCTION Please record the date of immunization for each antigen from the card 1. If the date is recorded but not readable, record 44 in day column 2. If the date is not recorded but a tick () mark is present, record 88 in day column 3. If neither date is recorded nor a tick () mark is present, prompt the mother for each such antigen and record 66 if she confirms the receipt of respective antigen by recall otherwise record 97.
Check IM0501-IM0516: Are all vaccines (BCG to Measles-2) recorded?
Has (name) ever received any vaccinations to prevent (him/her) from getting diseases, including vaccinations received in a campaign, immunization day or child health day?
Did (name) receive polio drops during the last campaign
How many times has (name) polio drops been given during the national polio campaigns?
. Has (name) ever received a BCG vaccination against tuberculosis – that is, an injection in the arm or shoulder that usually causes a scar?

. Has (name) ever received any vaccination drops in the mouth to protect (him/her) from polio? Probe by indicating that the first drop is usually given at birth and later at the same time as injections to prevent other diseases.
Were the first polio drops received in the first two weeks after birth?
How many times were the polio drops received at Govt or Private Health Facility or from Govt Outreach services? Number of times
How many times was Polio vaccine received during a large campaign?
The last time (name) received the polio drops, did (he/she) also get an injection to protect against polio? Probe to ensure that both were given, drops and injection

Has (name) ever received a Pentavalent vaccination – that is, an injection in the thigh to prevent (him/her) from getting tetanus, whooping cough, diphtheria, Hepatitis B disease, and Haemophilus influenza type B? Probe by indicating that Pentavalent vaccination is sometimes given at the same time as the Polio drops
How many times was the Pentavalent vaccine received? Number of times

Has (name) ever received a Pneumococcal Conjugate vaccination – that is, an injection to prevent (him/her) from getting pneumococcal disease, including ear infections and meningitis caused by pneumococcus? Probe by indicating that Pneumococcal Conjugate vaccination is sometimes given at the same time as the Pentavalent vaccination.
How many times was the pneumococcal vaccine received? Number of times

Has (name) ever received drops for Rotavirus vaccine (RV) vaccination- A vaccine given orally soon after 6 weeks birth to protect against rotavirus infections, which are the leading cause of severe diarrhea among young children.
How many times were the drops received? Number of times
Has (name) ever received an inactivated polio vaccine (IPV) – that is, a shot in the thigh at the age of 14 weeks or older - to prevent (him/her) from getting polio?
Has (name) ever received a Measles Injection – that is, a shot in the arm at the age of 9 months or older - to prevent (him/her) from getting measles?
How many times was a Measles Injection vaccine received? Number of times
Where from (name) is usually vaccinated? If the child is vaccinated from multiple sources, mention the usual source with higher frequency of vaccine doses.
Can you please specify where is this facility located?
What is the time taken to reach this facility where vaccination was received?

Why (name) is not vaccinated? If the child has not received all their vaccinations, ask the mother/caretaker Record all the reasons mentioned but do not prompt by asking specific. Encourage the mother to provide all reasons.
Child ill, brought but not vaccinated
Time or Place of immunization not Known
Took child but no vaccine available
Took child but not vaccination day
COVID-19-related (fear of going out, sickness in childInformation)
Section PD: Care seeking during pregnancy and delivery (To be administered to the mother of the youngest under-five child in the household)
Did you seek antenatal care during your last pregnancy?
From whom did you seek antenatal care?
Where did you seek antenatal care?

How many times did you receive antenatal care during last pregnancy? Probe to identify the number of times antenatal care was received. If a range is given, record the minimum number of times antenatal care received.
Why did you not seek antenatal care?
Assumption that care is not needed during pregnancy
On the advice of a relative or friend
ChildInformation knew how to care for you themselves
Have you ever taken any iron folic acid (IFA) while you were pregnant?
How often did you take IFA during pregnancy?
How many months or days did you take IFA?
During you last birth, where was the baby born?
If at home, why was the delivery not in a facility?
All my deliveries have been at home
My childInformation did not want me to go to a facility
Did anyone check on your health after delivery?
Who checked your health after delivery? [MULTIPLE RESPONSES]
How long after delivery did the first of these checks happen? If less than one day, record hours. If less than one week, record days. OTHERWISE, RECORD WEEKS.
How many times such check happen? Times
Did anyone check on (name of child) health?
Who checked the child’s health after delivery? [Multiple responses]
How long after delivery did the first of these checks happen? If less than one day, record hours. If less than one week, record days. Otherwise, record weeks.
How many times such check happen? Times
Section BF: Breastfeeding, Health & Care-seeking Behaviors Instruction: To be administered to the mother of the youngest child in the household, between 0-23 months of age
How long after birth did you first put (NAME) to the breast?
Did you feed first milk (colostrum) to the child?
Why did you not feed colostrum to (NAME)?
Was (NAME) given anything to drink before breast milk?
Was (NAME) breastfed yesterday during the day or at night?

Sometimes babies are fed breast milk in different ways, for example by spoon, cup, or bottle. This can happen when the mother cannot always be with her baby. Sometimes babies are breastfed by another woman, or given breast milk from another woman by spoon, cup or bottle or some other way. This can happen if a mother cannot breastfeed her own baby. Did (NAME) consume breast milk in any of these ways yesterday during the day or at night?
Now I would like to ask you about some medicines and vitamins that are sometimes given to infants. Was (NAME) given any vitamin drops or other medicines as drops yesterday during the day or at night?
Was (NAME) given ORS/NIMKOL yesterday during the day or at night?
Section G5: COVID (To be administered to the mother of the youngest under-five child in the household)
How concerned are you about COVID-19?
How deadly do you think COVID-19 is?
Do you know which group of people are most at risk of COVID?
Who do you trust for information around COVID? (Choose all that apply. Do not read the answers, let the respondent answer spontaneously)
Health Worker Via Door To Door
Will all people with COVID-19 show symptoms?
What symptoms are most commonly reported with COVID-19 (check all that apply)
What do you think are the different modes of transmission of COVID-19? (Choose all that apply. Do not read the answers, let the respondent answer spontaneously)
Touching surfaces contaminated with the virus
Directly coming in contact with an infected person’s body fluids such as blood, vomit, or sweat
Via droplets entering through mouth or nose when an infected person sneezes or coughs
Radio waves such as mobile networks
What according to you are effective methods of preventing infection from COVID-19? (Choose all that apply. Do not read the answers, let the respondent answer spontaneously)
Frequently washing hands using soap and water for 20 seconds
Covering mouth and nose using a tissue or flexed elbow while coughing or sneezing
Avoiding contact with sick people showing signs of COVID-19
Wearing a mask in public places
Has COVID-19, the subsequent lockdown & restrictions and fear affected the nutrition and feeding of your child?
How has it affected breastfeeding and/or feeding of the child? (Choose all that apply. Do not read the answers, let the respondent answer spontaneously)
I have reduced the frequency and amount I feed my child
I have increased the frequency and amount I feed my child
I cannot afford same food for child
I cannot travel to markets to purchase food 4 The foods I feed my child are no longer
Has COVID-19, the subsequent lockdown & restrictions and fear disrupted your child’s immunization?
Has your child (under-5) received oral polio vaccine in the past 10 months?
Has your child received all vaccinations in the past 10 months that were due as per EPI schedule?
If not, why was the child not taken for vaccination?
Forgot that there was a vaccine due
Has the number of times you visit health facilities reduced during COVID-19?
Forgot that there was a vaccine due
For what conditions have you decided to not go to the doctor?
My child had fever or cough
My child’s health issue, prefer not specify
My health, prefer not to specify
What is the mother tongue of the head of the household?
Main material of the dwelling floor
What is the primary construction material used to build the house (by observation)?
Observe the primary construction material Used to build the roof?
What is the ownership status of this house?
If this house is rental, what is the monthly rent of this house? (Rupees)
How many rooms in this HH are used for sleeping?(number)
What is the main source of drinking water In this HH?
Do you do anything to the water to make it safer to drink?
What do you usually do to make the water safer to drink? Anything else? RECORD ALL MENTIONED
What kind of toilet facility do members of your HH usually use?
What is the drainage system of this HH? (Through observation)
We would like to learn about the places that households use to wash their hands. Can you please show me where members of your household most often wash their hands?
Not Observed, No Permission to See
Observe presence of water at the place of washing RECORD OBSERVATION
Observe presence of soap, detergent, or other cleansing agent at the place for handwashing. RECORD OBSERVATION
Soap or Detergent (Bar, Liquid, Powder, Paste)
Do you have any soap or detergent in your household for hand washing?
If yes, can you please show it to me? [Multiple responses]
In what situations do you wash your hands with soap? This is an open-ended question. Do not read the answer choices.
After defecating or using the latrine
What fuel does your HH use for cooking?
What transport does most of the childInformation members of this HH usually use? (select all that apply)
What technique do you use to stop the breeding of flies and mosquitos? [Multiple responses]
Does anyone in your household own a mobile phone?
How many mobile phones are there in your household?
How many of these are smartphones?
How many of these smartphones are Android-based?
Which mobile service provider is the Android-based smartphone connected to? [Multiple responses]
What connectivity speed does the Android-based smartphone have? [Multiple responses]
Does the caregiver of a young child in the household have access to the Android smartphone or not?
Who owns their own Android smart phone? [Multiple responses]
Where do your childInformation members usually go to seek care?
From whom do your childInformation members usually seek care?
How much time does it take to reach any govt or private health care facility near your house by walking?
For how long you had been living in this house?
Do you have any plans to shift somewhere else next year?
Has your household or anyone in your household received financial assistance in last 12 months?
If yes, then please identify which program they are registered with? [Multiple Responses]
When was the last payment received from this program?
Is a financial assistance program receipt available? Observed by surveyor. RECORD OBSERVATION
Have you or anyone in the household received a food supplement from an organization in the past 12 months?
" Please add Info for second child."
